tweets.html:
"Why American Television Needs A Break From Violence, Conspiracies, And Maybe Even Serialized Storytelling"

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) December 4, 2012

TV critic very much living inside the critically-acclaimed TV bubble: let me introduce you to the other 700 channels on your box.

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) December 4, 2012

Oh come on, CBS/"Good Wife." How is it possible that NOTHING has been set up at http://t.co/MO4XLmFZ?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 4, 2012

Really tearing through my "Katt Williams Arrest" advent calendar.

— Chase Mitchell (@ChaseMit) December 4, 2012

Before we jump to conclusions about Katt Williams, we need to examine the possibility that Andy Dick is not above going out in blackface.

— Vanessa Ramos (@thatRamosgirl) December 4, 2012

I may have doctored this tweet. RT @NikkiFinke: Sean Bean To [Die] In TNT Pilot ‘Legends’

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 4, 2012

I'm not 100% convinced Chevy knew he was shooting an Old Navy commercial and not another National Lampoon sequel.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) December 5, 2012

My arc as a L&O: SVU watcher: "Gah, is anything else on?"-"The cops are assholes."-"Christ this is depressing."-"YOU GO TO HELL, BAD GUY."

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) December 5, 2012

I refuse to follow @TheCancelBear because I prefer a little river in Egypt. You may have heard of it. It's called da Nile, yo.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) December 5, 2012

Try as they may, some TV shows just aren't as good as we want them to be.

— Amy Berg (@bergopolis) December 5, 2012

I wish there was a button on my remote that I could push when I get sick of a character on a show and Dexter would show up and kill them.

— Bryan Donaldson (@TheNardvark) December 5, 2012

Top Chef S10 spoilers: CJ throws John thru a plate glass window. Stefan cheats on Fabio w/Kristin. OK hipster gets 'stache in Tom's risotto.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) December 5, 2012

#StorageWars is the best show about wars involving storage of things.

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) December 5, 2012

#Parenthood is TV's best show about parenthood.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

Girls is TV's best show about being a girl.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

Sons Of Anarchy is TV's best show about the loneliness of being raised by anarchists.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

New Girl is TV's best show for all you new girls out there.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

Is your name Louie? Boy, are you in luck!

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

@tvoti Revenge is the best TV show about revenge. (Did I get this right?)

— aka Meat Fork (@fscott24) December 5, 2012

I think I'm kind of over "domino effect" storytelling in which a season of set-up get paid off in the finale. Maybe. Can't tell yet.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 5, 2012

@TVMcGee We're going to have to wait another couple of weeks to see if this Tweet pays off, eh?

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

Twitter is 89% TVguide.

— Jenni Konner (@JenniKonner) December 5, 2012

Maybe I'll get caught up on Arrow this weekend while I work out in my giant industrial warehouse workout space.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

Is Jeff Zucker already manning CNN's Twitter account? “@CNN: Snake on a plane forces emergency landing. http://t.co/lyvtCSaN”

— Yinka Adegoke (@YinkaWrites) December 5, 2012

Sharkenfreude: the pleasure of following the bitter tweets as a TV show I never got around to watching falls apart.

— Ted Friedman (@tedfriedman) December 5, 2012

Meeting: "Who's the most least famous person we can get for our online school's tv ads?" "...um,Shannon Doherty?" "Great. Then that's lunch"

— Brandon McCarthy (@BMcCarthy32) December 5, 2012

Quick rule of thumb for Rankin/Bass specials: If Santa'a not a dick, it's not worth it. (Santa Claus Is Coming To Town being an exception).

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) December 5, 2012

I think the Santa in #Rudolph is my favorite interpretation of Santa. He doesn't have time for this nonsense.

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) December 5, 2012

Does before bros. #Rudolph #ReindeerGames

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) December 5, 2012

Tonight I think I shall live tweet my queer reading if Rudolph........ Unless I get bored.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

Santa. Keeper of the patriarchy.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

Uh oh. Rudolph is born different. And Santa is no Lady Gaga. This little monster won't do.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

And poor Rudolph, forced out of the closet. Not allowed to play with the others.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

There's Always Tomorrow is this show's Over the Rainbow. Hopefully out little queer friends will find their tomorrow

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

Much like Hermie's hair, Yukon Cornelius's handlebar mustache is self explanatory.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

Okay. We've hit the queer ghetto. Sad misfits cast away from society. A whole island of literally little toy monsters.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

Our little Rudolph is becoming a man. Will this mean recuperation to the straight fold or a life of queerness?

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

Our little island of misfits is finding rescue! Is it only me that wishes they could build a misfit society?

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

So. Yes, our little Rudolph is recuperated back into the patriarchal fold, but that fold is just a little queerer than when we started.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

And our favorite queer twosome and their vanquished abomination have found a place in the fold. Merry queerness indeed!

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) December 5, 2012

As ever, I'm troubled by that damn doll on the Island Of Misfit Toys. What's wrong with her? Who did she kill?

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) December 5, 2012

You better not pout. Eric Roberts is coming to town. Honestly, don't pout it makes him viol--- just don't pout. #EricRobertsChristmasCarols

— John Moe (@johnmoe) December 5, 2012

The reason I love Twitter: all of the people telling me that Chris Brody's dream has come true & the Wizards are actually up 5 on the Heat.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) December 5, 2012

@andygreenwald The Wizards are beating the Heat. Chris Brody is watching this on one of several big screens, and he is pumped.

— Dragos Nica (@DragosNica) December 5, 2012

#chrisbrodywasright

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) December 5, 2012

Bottom line: HOMELAND is not nearly as implausible as some suggest.

— Andy Greenwald (@andygreenwald) December 5, 2012

Cee-Lo Green got his jacket from Elizabeth Taylor's closet tonight... #TheVoice

— Mark W. (@marqualler) December 5, 2012

Do bachelor auctions exist in real life or is this just one of those things TV made up? #HartofDixie

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) December 5, 2012

So...watching Three's Company earlier made me realize Hart of Dixie is sort of the Southern-fried dramedy version of that show?

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) December 5, 2012

Hi FOX, my accruing goodwill toward #NewGirl is set way back when you pop-up ads for "Zooey's makeup kit" during the show.

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) December 5, 2012

Tonight, "Raising Hope" became the first show to feature CGI squirrel rape since S.1 of "Downton Abbey."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 5, 2012

Now Tobolowsky's gone? Way to show you've got a hand on the wheel #TheMindyProject

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) December 5, 2012

Whoa: did Happy Endings just make an ultra-dirty joke about the word "quaint"? That out-filthified last year's "digital dial" joke.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) December 5, 2012

Penny is ah-mah-zing. #helmet #concussion #howdidigethere #HappyEndings

— Philiana (@insidethetube) December 5, 2012

I hope that this special holiday Shark Tank is aired every year for the next 500 centuries.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

tweets.html:
Seriously never watching a show called "Shark Tank" that has nothing to do with sharks whatsoever. What a WASTE of a title!

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) December 5, 2012

Mark Cuban seriously throws off the curve on Shark Tank because he has so much money he can just throw it away.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

Really, really like #BenAndKate--and that he calls her "dude."

— Kelli Marshall (@KelliMarshall) December 5, 2012

Whenever I watch Ben and Kate I wonder why this show isn't a much bigger hit. Funny funny stuff.

— Matt Marcotte (@MattMarcotte) December 5, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Honestly, if you don't love #BenAndKate, I'm just gonna go ahead and say you have no soul.

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) December 5, 2012

have literally muted #BenandKate from my feed. You guys are worse than 50 billion Browncoats.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) December 5, 2012

I like Ben & Kate. Quite a bit, actually. But sometimes I wish everybody would shut up about it!

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

I've never seen anything transition into "show it feels I've been watching for 6 years and am over" faster than Ben & Kate.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) December 5, 2012

SONS OF ANARCHY S5 finale: wherein FX again asserts that it is the "Holy shit! Was that necessary?" network.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) December 5, 2012

Trying to decide how a face full of nails compares to a face full of electric stove coil. #SOA #theshield #sutterink #gnarly

— DamningW/FaintPraise (@JustinHarlacher) December 5, 2012

Well, that was a very dark, draining season of Sons of Anarchy (Venus Van Dam aside). Ready for the light whimsy of Justified. #fourkidneys

— Teri Vogel (@tmvogel) December 5, 2012

"Sons of Anarchy" will win an Emmy for "Special Achievement in Wood Paneling."

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) December 5, 2012

I am not ready for the shit that's going to go down in this episode. #Parenthood

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 5, 2012

tweets.html:
Starting #Parenthood now. Why aren't there more Joel/Amber scenes?! WHY?!?! [screams to heavens]

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) December 5, 2012

Uncle Joel is the best. #parenthood

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) December 5, 2012

No child is that excited to move to Minnesota. #Parenthood

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 5, 2012

Good god in heaven, I am loving this scene in which Stoned Christina explains to Julia how to bribe her kid.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) December 5, 2012

This "Kristina gives parenting advice while high" scene wins everything. #Parenthood

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 5, 2012

Man, Monica Potter is really good at playing stoned.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) December 5, 2012

"I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I'm smoking pot. I was just doping it up." #Parenthood really speaks from the heart.

— ultralight meme (@GDS3000) December 5, 2012

“Take a shower. There’s three fish.” This is the greatest scene. #parenthood

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) December 5, 2012

@crsbecker We needed that scene because Sarah and Mark breaking up was too sad.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 5, 2012

@cassiebelek Just….Mark’s face….I can’t even.

@crsbecker I mean, we all cry on the treadmill, but when he did it my heart hurt.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 5, 2012

Does anyone know a nice girl for Mark? #Parenthood

I want Drew from #Parenthood and Chris from #Homeland to have a gladiator fight.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 5, 2012

They should dismiss this Parenthood lawsuit just on the basis that Marlize (Marlyse?) is a weird name.

I like how whenever Glen Hansard sings everyone just kind of stands around in awe. AS THEY SHOULD. #Parenthood

Heh. Glen Hansard drives a Camry. #Parenthood

Glen Hansard is an illegal parker? I refuse to believe it. #Parenthood

So was Marie actually telling the truth at all those open houses when talking about her other lives? #Parenthood #BreakingBad

— ultralight meme (@GDS3000) December 5, 2012

Sydney is such a little Julia. #Parenthood

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) December 5, 2012

My feelings about Ray Romano on Parenthood make me uncomfortable.

— Sarah Heyward (@shinyunicorn) December 5, 2012

Damn you, #Parenthood preview. Damn you. #crying

Next week = soul killer. I'm already crying. #Parenthood

I was BAKING COOKIES and still immediately became sad. RT @crsbecker: Oh good lord. #parenthoodpreview

WAIT, THEY'RE GOING TO DO A CHRISTMAS CANCER EPISODE? Is Parenthood trying to kill me?

Nearly got through #Parenthood without turning into a sobbing mess. Then I saw the promo for next week and lost it. I need a support group.

Oh shit, #Parenthood is bringing out the big guns next week. Time for a tissue run.

I think it would be really romantic to stay in and uglycry watching Parenthood, then swap tears making out. Am I broken.
